verbose_text: Since insulin stimulates adipogenesis and leptin production in adipocytes whereas leptin inhibits the production of insulin in pancreatic beta-cells, a prolonged elevation of plasma leptin levels would result in dysregulation of the adipoinsular axis and a corresponding failure to suppress insulin secretion [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: leptin levels would result in dysregulation of the adipoinsular axis and a corresponding failure to suppress insulin
